Note on üá∞üá∑ Coupang $CPNG vs üá¶üá∑MercadoLibre $MELI.

(I recently spent time in üá∞üá∑South Korea, $CPNG vans and parcels were everywhere. When I was in LATAM $MELI was much less visible).

And that is kind of why I prefer owning $MELI vs $CPNG. Why? Because I am more attracted to investing ins Compounding runway vs Maturity. Let's compare both:

Let's start with $CPNG :
1) üá∞üá∑ South Korea has the world's highest e-commerce penetration rate. Internet and digital services are highly penetrated leaving smaller whitespace to conquer.

2) Walking around üá∞üá∑ Seoul, this is highly obvious: Coupang is everywhere: groceries, appliances, B2B, same-day delivery. Massive success. Koreans use it to but anything from broccoli to iPhone, delivered within 24hrs.
> It's great success for $CPNG. But that also means most of the market is already won.

3) In Korea üá∞üá∑, everyone is already banked, with OG banks or Fintechs. Coupang Pay, wallets, or cards didn‚Äôt feel dominant or present. Which is why I don‚Äôt really see an e-commerce + fintech flywheel forming.

4) South Korea has a history of state capitalism and picking winners (chaebols). Recently, the government has gone after Coupang, which has spooked investors and even led @altcap to sue.

While this looks scary, Coupang is so ubiquitous that I don‚Äôt see it as much of a threat or concern. $CPNG ain't going anywhere.

Moving on to $MELI : üá¶üá∑The exact opposite setup.

1) E-commerce + internet economy still underpenetrated (4x less than SK), but growing very fast. $MELI already built the rails and infra to scale alongside that growth.

2) Fintech is still early inüá¶üá∑ LATAM. Large parts of LatAm are underbanked, with low fintech or banking penetration. (1.3% unbaked in SK vs 27% in LATAM). $MELI is again well position to capture this market.

3) $MELI is creating an incredibly powerful MercadoPago/credit/e-com reinforcing flywheel and eco-system across LATAM (amazingly well documented by @CapexAndChill )

Conclusion
- Since $CPNG is already highly penetrated ‚Üí growth likely reverts to GDP+ sooner than for $MELI.
- Expansion into Japan or Taiwan has more execution risk for $CPNG. (@the_zack_zhu documents this well)
- MELI is a category leader riding secular tailwinds in largely white-space market.
- Each of $MELI business line reinforces the others > creating stronger compounding force.

I like both companies, but $MELI is clearly earlier in the cycle, with secular tailwinds and compounding still ahead.

PS: I also like both as a de-dollarization portfolio hedge.
